rv, consensus hasn't been established that this isn't reliable or notable. check the afd page. people think that it is in fact notable.
not a reliable or notable source
"A hate crime or bias motivated crime occurs when the perpetrator of the crime intentionally selects the victim because of his or her membership in a certain group."

/* United States */ Hate crime laws have a long history in the United States. The first hate crime laws where passed after the [[American Civil War]]. The modern era of hate-crime legislation was begun in 1968 with the passage of federal statute, 18

/* History */ Hate crimes have a history longer than the US itself with [[genocide]] attempted against [[Native America]] by the Dutch, French, Spanish, and British [[colonists]] and later American citizens for over three centuries. The verb ''[[lync

A hate crime is a [[legal category]] used to described '''bias-motivated violence''': "[[assault]], [[injury]], and [[murder]] on the basis of certain personal characteristics: different appearance, different color, different nationality, different l
+A '''hate crime law''' is a law intended to prevent bias-motivated violence.
European Union, cyber hate crimes, ref
/* Germany */ Added information about the frequency of hate crimes and the lack of awareness of hate crimes in Germany to the article.

Removed extensive information on hate speech legislation in Germany, which is not directly relevant to hate crime laws. Information about hate speech laws in Germany should go into the hate speech article (which I linked to).
